intro: Oxera pulchella var. brevicalyx, commonly known as the narrow-leaved oxera, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It is a low-growing perennial shrub characterized by its small, ovate leaves and clusters of yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or rocky areas. Its flowers are actinomorphic, with five petals and numerous stamens, typical of the Rubiaceae family. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that disperses seeds through wind or animals.
